qas.question: What do oxygen tanks, cryogenics, and chemical compounds serve as for oxygen?
In what state is oxygen shipped in bulk?

answers.text: as a liquid in specially insulated tankers

qas.question: By what means is bulk oxygen shipped?
In what form is oxygen transported in smaller containers?
What type of organization would need large quantities of pure oxygen?
What is the cryogenic and chemical compound storage method?
Why is oxygen often transported in cryogenics?
What is equivalent to 804 liters of gaseous oxygen?

context: Oxygen <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><a0_4>storage<a0_3/><a0_1/><a0_0/> methods<a0_4/><a0_2/> include <b5_0>high pressure oxygen tanks<b5_0/>, cryogenics and chemical compounds. For <b6_0>reasons of economy<b6_0/>, oxygen is often transported in bulk <a1_1><a1_3>as a <a1_0><a1_2>liquid<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> in <a2_3>specially <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>insulated tankers<a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/><a1_3/>, since <b7_0>one liter of liquefied oxygen<b7_0/> is equivalent to 840 liters of <b8_0>gaseous oxygen<b8_0/> at atmospheric pressure and 20 °C (68 °F). Such tankers are used to refill bulk liquid oxygen storage containers, which stand outside <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3><a4_4>hospitals<a4_4/><a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> and other institutions with a need for large volumes of pure oxygen gas. Liquid oxygen is passed through heat exchangers, which convert the cryogenic liquid into gas before it enters the building. Oxygen is also stored and shipped in smaller cylinders containing the <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3><a3_4>compressed gas<a3_4/><a3_3/><a3_1/><a3_0/>;<a3_2/> a form that is useful in certain portable medical applications and oxy-fuel welding and cutting.
